member.summary: The route is calculated to minimize the time. Traffic information is not used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptimization.TimeWithTraffic
member.summary: The route is calculated to minimize the time and uses current traffic information.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.Avoid
member.summary: Specifies the road types to minimize or avoid when a route is created for the driving travel mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.BorderRestrictions
member.summary: Specifies the border crossing preference with respect to countries, dependent territories, special areas of geographical interest, states, subdivision, or provinces

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.DistanceBeforeFirstTurn
member.summary: Specifies the distance before the first turn is allowed in the route. An integer distance specified in meters. Use this parameter to make sure that the moving vehicle has enough distance to make the first turn.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.Heading
member.summary: Specifies the initial heading for the route. An integer value between 0 and 359 that represents degrees from north where north is 0 degrees and the heading is specified clockwise from north. For example, setting the heading of 270 degrees creates a route that initially heads west.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.Optimize
member.summary: Specifies what parameters to use to optimize the route

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.OptimizeWaypoints
member.summary: Instructs the API to rearrange the route waypoints and reduce the route cost specified with the optimize parameter. The route first waypoint and last waypoint order is not changed, their position is considered fixed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.RouteAttributes
member.summary: Specify to include or exclude parts of the routes response.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.DistanceUnit
member.summary: The units to use for distance in the response.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.DateTime
member.summary: When specified and the route is optimized for timeWithTraffic, predictive traffic data is used to calculate the best route for the specified date time of departure.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.TruckRouteOptions.Tolerances
member.summary: A set of double values. Each value specifies a tolerance that is used to reduce the number of points needed to display a route on a map and still maintain the route shape. If a point is removed and the new route still falls within the specified tolerance of the old route, then the point is not included in the subset of points returned for that tolerance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.ElevationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the elevation to be calculated.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.Points
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of coordinates on the Earth to use in elevation calculations. The exact use of these points depends on the type of elevation request.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangular area over which to provide elevation values.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows to use to divide the bounding box area into a grid. The rows that define the bounding box each count as two (2) of the rows. Elevation values are returned for all vertices of the grid. Integers with a value of two 2 or greater. The number of rows and columns can define a maximum of 1024 locations (rows * cols <= 1024).

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns to use to divide the bounding box area into a grid. The columns that define the bounding box each count as two (2) of the columns. Elevation values are returned for all vertices of the grid. Integers with a value of two 2 or greater. The number of rows and columns can define a maximum of 1024 locations (rows * cols <= 1024).

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.Samples
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of equally-spaced elevation values to provide along a polyline path. A positive integer. The maximum number of samples is 1024.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.Options
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional parameters for an elevation request.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationRequest.UserData
member.summary: Gets or sets user data. This data will be passed to the response which corresponds to this request. It can be used to identify request-response pair, for example. User data can be obtain from the response through the RequestUserData property.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationType
member.summary: Defines the different types of elevation requests that can be performed.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationType.List
member.summary: Get elevations for latitude and longitude coordinates. Required parameters of the : Points

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationType.Polyline
member.summary: Get elevations at equally-spaced locations along a polyline path. Required parameters of the : Points, Samples

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationType.Bounds
member.summary: Get elevations at equally-spaced locations within an area on the Earth defined as a bounding box. Required parameters of the : Bounds, Rows, Columns

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.ElevationType.SeaLevel
member.summary: Get the offset of the geoid sea level Earth model from the ellipsoid Earth model at a set of latitude and longitude coordinates. Required parameters of the : Points

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptimization
member.summary: Contains values that represent route calculation methods.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptimization.Distance
member.summary: The route is calculated to minimize the total distance. Traffic information is not used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptimization.Time
member.summary: The route is calculated to minimize the total time. Traffic information is not used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptimization.TimeWithTraffic
member.summary: The route is calculated to minimize the time and uses current traffic information.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptimization.TimeAvoidClosure
member.summary: The route is calculated to minimize the time and avoid road closures. Traffic information is not used.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions
member.summary: Contains properties used to refine a route service request.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RouteOptions class.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets type of directions to return. The default value is TravelMode.Driving.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.Optimization
member.summary: Gets or sets the calculation method to use. The default value is RouteOptimization.MinimizeTime.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.RouteAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to include or exclude parts of the routes response. The default value is RouteAttributes.ExcludeItinerary.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.RouteAvoidance
member.summary: Gets or sets value specifying how traffic information is used in the route calculation. The default value is TrafficUsage.None.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.DistanceBeforeFirstTurn
member.summary: Specifies the distance before the first turn is allowed in the route. This option only applies to the driving travel mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.Heading
member.summary: An integer value between 0 and 359 that represents degrees from north where north is 0 degrees and the heading is specified clockwise from north.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.Tolerances
member.summary: Specifies a series of tolerance values. Each value produces a subset of points that approximates the route that is described by the full set of points.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.DateTime
member.summary: When specified and the route is optimized for timeWithTraffic, predictive traffic data is used to calculate the best route for the specified date time.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteOptions.MaxSolutions
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of driving routes to return. Should be an integer value between 1 and 3. The default value is 1.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteAttributes
member.summary: Contains route attributes that modify the result returned by a route calculation request.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteAttributes.ExcludeItinerary
member.summary: Do not include detailed directions in the response. Detailed directions are provided as itinerary items and contain details such as written instructions and traffic location codes.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteAttributes.RoutePath
member.summary: Include a set of point (latitude and longitude) values that describe the routes path in the response.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteAttributes.RouteSummariesOnly
member.summary: Include only travel time and distance for the route, and do not provide other information.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Map.Bing.RouteAttributes.All
member.summary: Used to specify the following attributes as a group: ExcluteItinerary and RoutePath.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ExtendedDataConverter
member.summary: Value converter to access extended data properties from XAML. 2-way binding can't be specified.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ExtendedDataConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a value.
member.param: The value produced by the binding source.
The type of the binding target property.

The converter parameter to use. It can be specified in a few different ways:
Simple name of the extended property.
Formatted extended property. For example: "SUM_SQMI_A|F2". The '|' character is used to separate extended property name and its output format.
Format string which can use number of the extended properties. For example: "{CNTRY_NAME} Miles: {SUM_SQMI_A|F2}, KM: {SUM_SQKM_A|F1}".
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A converted value. If the method returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic), the valid null value is used.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ExtendedDataConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a binding target value to the source binding values.
member.param: The value that the binding target produces.
The array of types to convert to. The array length indicates the number and types of values that are suggested for the method to return.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.

member.summary: Get values from the extended data according to the format string.

Language.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference
member.summary: The OGC Spatial Reference requirements.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.AngularUnitOfMeasurement
member.summary: The measurement units used to define the angles of a spheroid or ellipse associated with a specific datum. The datum is usually WGS (World Geodetic System) 1984 and the unit of measurement is a degree.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.Authority
member.summary: The authority body that defines the standards for the spatial reference parameters. Spatial Reference is usually WGS 1984 and the authority is EPSG:4326.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.CentralMeridian
member.summary: The line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.Datum
member.summary: This indicates the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.DatumAuthority
member.summary: This indicates the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.FalseEasting
member.summary: The value added to all "x" values in the rectangular coordinate for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.FalseNorthing
member.summary: The value added to all "y" values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.GeoGcs
member.summary: A coordinate system based on latitude and longitude. Some geographic coordinate systems are Latitude/Longitude, and some are Longitude/Latitude. You can find out which this is by examining the axes. You should also check the angular units, since not all geographic coordinate systems use degrees.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.LatitudeOfOrigin
member.summary: The latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinate for a map projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.Primem
member.summary: This defines the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.PrimemAuthority
member.summary: This defines the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.ProjectionAuthority
member.summary: This describes a projection from geographic coordinates to projected coordinates.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.SpheroidRadius
member.summary: This describes a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.SpheroidFlattening
member.summary: This describes a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.SpheroidAuthority
member.summary: This describes a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.StandardParallel
member.summary: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ISpatialReference.UnitAuthority
member.summary: The authority body that defines the unit of measurement i.e. European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG). The unit of measurement is usually degrees and the authority for the datum the map uses, WGS 1984 is EPSG:4326.

member.summary: Gets or sets the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.SpatialReference.UnitAuthority

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.MapSearchBarElement.Search(System.String)
member.summary: Initiates a new search. First if there is an subscriber to the the event is raised. Search handling is left to the user. If there is no subscriber to the event the method checks the SearchProvider property. If the property is set a new async search is started. The user should handle the search result. If the property is not set the method traverses the providers in the Providers collection of the map element. If a search provider is found a new async search is started. The user should handle the search result.
member.param: The criteria.

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Adapters.RAdapter
member.summary:
Platform adapter to bridge platform specific objects to HTML Renderer core library.
Core uses abstract renderer objects (RAdapter/RControl/REtc...) to access platform specific functionality, the concrete platforms implements those objects to provide concrete platform implementation. Those allowing the core library to be platform agnostic.
Platforms: WinForms, WPF, Metro, PDF renders, etc.
Objects: UI elements(Controls), Graphics(Render context), Colors, Brushes, Pens, Fonts, Images, Clipboard, etc.
member.remarks:
It is best to have a singleton instance of this class for concrete implementation!
This is because it holds caches of default CssData, Images, Fonts and Brushes.

member.summary: used to return empty array

member.summary: Init.

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData.Parse(TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Adapters.RAdapter,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Parse the given stylesheet to object.
If is true the parsed css blocks are added to the default css data (as defined by W3), merged if class name already exists. If false only the data in the given stylesheet is returned.
member.param: Platform adapter
the stylesheet source to parse
true - combine the parsed css data with default css data, false - return only the parsed css data

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData.MediaBlocks
member.summary: dictionary of media type to dictionary of css class name to the cssBlocks collection with all the data

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData.ContainsCssBlock(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check if there are css blocks for the given class selector.
member.param: the class selector to check for css blocks by
optional: the css media type (default - all)
member.returns: true - has css blocks for the class, false - otherwise

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData.GetCssBlock(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Get collection of css blocks for the requested class selector.
the can be: class name, html element name, html element and class name (elm.class), hash tag with element id (#id).
returned all the blocks that word on the requested class selector, it can contain simple selector or hierarchy selector.
member.param: the class selector to get css blocks by
optional: the css media type (default - all)
member.returns: collection of css blocks, empty collection if no blocks exists (never null)

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData.AddCssBlock(System.String,TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Entities.CssBlock)
member.summary: Add the given css block to the css data, merging to existing block if required.
member.remarks:
If there is no css blocks for the same class it will be added to data collection.
If there is already css blocks for the same class it will check for each existing block if the hierarchical selectors match (or not exists). if do the two css blocks will be merged into one where the new block properties overwrite existing if needed. if the new block doesn't mach any existing it will be added either to the beginning of the list if it has no hierarchical selectors or at the end.
Css block without hierarchical selectors must be added to the beginning of the list so more specific block can overwrite it when the style is applied.
member.param: the media type to add the CSS to
the css block to add

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData.Combine(TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData)
member.summary:
Combine this CSS data blocks with CSS blocks for each media.
Merge blocks if exists in both.
member.param: the CSS data to combine with

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData.Clone
member.summary: Create deep copy of the css data with cloned css blocks.

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox.CreateBox(TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.HtmlTag,TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox)
member.summary: Create new css box for the given parent with the given html tag.

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox.CreateBox(TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox,TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.HtmlTag,TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox)
member.summary:
Create new css box for the given parent with the given optional html tag and insert it either at the end or before the given optional box.
If no html tag is given the box will be anonymous.
If no before box is given the new box will be added at the end of parent boxes collection.
If before box doesn't exists in parent box exception is thrown.
member.remarks: To learn more about anonymous inline boxes visit: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visuren.html#anonymous
member.param: the box to add the new box to it as child
optional: the html tag to define the box
optional: to insert as specific location in parent box

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox.CreateBlock
member.summary: Create new css block box.

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox.CreateBlock(TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox,TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.HtmlTag,TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBox)
member.summary:
Create new css block box for the given parent with the given optional html tag and insert it either at the end or before the given optional box.
If no html tag is given the box will be anonymous.
If no before box is given the new box will be added at the end of parent boxes collection.
If before box doesn't exists in parent box exception is thrown.
member.remarks: To learn more about anonymous block boxes visit CSS spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visuren.html#anonymous-block-level
member.param: the box to add the new block box to it as child
optional: the html tag to define the box
optional: to insert as specific location in parent box

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Dom.CssBoxProperties
member.summary:
Base class for css box to handle the css properties.
Has field and property for every css property that can be set, the properties add additional parsing like setting the correct border depending what border value was set (single, two , all four).
Has additional fields to control the location and size of the box and 'actual' css values for some properties that require additional calculations and parsing.

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Entities.HtmlImageLoadCallback
member.summary:
Callback used in to allow setting image externally and async.
The callback can provide path to image file path, URL or the actual image to use.
If is given (not ) then only the specified rectangle will be used from the loaded image and not all of it, also the rectangle will be used for size and not the actual image size.
member.param: the path to the image to load (file path or URL)
the image to use
optional: limit to specific rectangle in the loaded image

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Entities.HtmlImageLoadEventArgs
member.summary:
Invoked when an image is about to be loaded by file path, URL or inline data in 'img' element or background-image CSS style.
Allows to overwrite the loaded image by providing the image object manually, or different source (file or URL) to load from.
Example: image 'src' can be non-valid string that is interpreted in the overwrite delegate by custom logic to resource image object
Example: image 'src' in the html is relative - the overwrite intercepts the load and provide full source URL to load the image from
Example: image download requires authentication - the overwrite intercepts the load, downloads the image to disk using custom code and provide file path to load the image from. Can also use the asynchronous image overwrite not to block HTML rendering is applicable.
If no alternative data is provided the original source will be used.

member.name: F:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Entities.HtmlImageLoadEventArgs._handled
member.summary: use to cancel the image loading by html renderer, the provided image will be used.

member.summary: the source of the image (file path or uri)

member.summary: collection of all the attributes that are defined on the image element

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Handlers.ImageDownloader
member.summary:
Handler for downloading images from the web.
Single instance of the handler used for all images downloaded in a single html, this way if the html contains more than one reference to the same image it will be downloaded only once.
Also handles corrupt, partial and canceled downloads by first downloading to temp file and only if successful moving to cached file location.

member.summary:
Handler for all loading image logic.
Loading by .
Loading by file path.
Loading by URI.

remarks.para: Supports sync and async image loading.

If the image object is created by the handler on calling dispose of the handler the image will be released, this makes release of unused images faster as they can be large.
Disposing image load handler will also cancel download of image from the web.

member.summary:
Calculate the character index and offset by characters for the given word and given offset.
If the location is below the word line then set the selection to the end.
If the location is to the right of the word then set the selection to the end.
If the offset is to the left of the word set the selection to the beginning.
Otherwise calculate the width of each substring to find the char the location is on.
member.param: used to create graphics to measure string
the word to calculate its index and offset
the location to calculate for
is to include the first character in the calculation
return the index of the char under the location
return the offset of the char under the location

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.HtmlContainerInt
member.summary:
Low level handling of Html Renderer logic.
Allows html layout and rendering without association to actual control, those allowing to handle html rendering on any graphics object.
Using this class will require the client to handle all propagation's of mouse/keyboard events, layout/paint calls, scrolling offset, location/size/rectangle handling and UI refresh requests.

remarks.para:
MaxSize and ActualSize:
The max width and height of the rendered html.
The max width will effect the html layout wrapping lines, resize images and tables where possible.
The max height does NOT effect layout, but will not render outside it (clip).
can exceed the max size by layout restrictions (unwrap-able line, set image size, etc.).
Set zero for unlimited (width/height separately).

ScrollOffset:
This will adjust the rendered html by the given offset so the content will be "scrolled".
Element that is rendered at location (50,100) with offset of (0,200) will not be rendered at -100, therefore outside the client rectangle.

LinkClicked event
Raised when the user clicks on a link in the html.
Allows canceling the execution of the link to overwrite by custom logic.
If error occurred in event handler it will propagate up the stack.

StylesheetLoad event:
Raised when a stylesheet is about to be loaded by file path or URL in 'link' element.
Allows to overwrite the loaded stylesheet by providing the stylesheet data manually, or different source (file or URL) to load from.
Example: The stylesheet 'href' can be non-valid URI string that is interpreted in the overwrite delegate by custom logic to pre-loaded stylesheet object
If no alternative data is provided the original source will be used.

ImageLoad event:
Raised when an image is about to be loaded by file path, URL or inline data in 'img' element or background-image CSS style.
Allows to overwrite the loaded image by providing the image object manually, or different source (file or URL) to load from.
Example: image 'src' can be non-valid string that is interpreted in the overwrite delegate by custom logic to resource image object
Example: image 'src' in the html is relative - the overwrite intercepts the load and provide full source URL to load the image from
Example: image download requires authentication - the overwrite intercepts the load, downloads the image to disk using custom code and provide file path to load the image from.
If no alternative data is provided the original source will be used.

Refresh event:
Raised when html renderer requires refresh of the control hosting (invalidation and re-layout).
There is no guarantee that the event will be raised on the main thread, it can be raised on thread-pool thread.

RenderError event:
Raised when an error occurred during html rendering.

member.summary:

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.HtmlContainerInt.CssData
member.summary: the parsed stylesheet data used for handling the html

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.HtmlContainerInt.AvoidGeometryAntialias
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if anti-aliasing should be avoided for geometry like backgrounds and borders (default - false).

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.HtmlContainerInt.AvoidAsyncImagesLoading
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if image asynchronous loading should be avoided (default - false).
True - images are loaded synchronously during html parsing.
False - images are loaded asynchronously to html parsing when downloaded from URL or loaded from disk.
member.remarks:
Asynchronously image loading allows to unblock html rendering while image is downloaded or loaded from disk using IO ports to achieve better performance.
Asynchronously image loading should be avoided when the full html content must be available during render, like render to image.

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.HtmlContainerInt.AvoidImagesLateLoading
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if image loading only when visible should be avoided (default - false).
True - images are loaded as soon as the html is parsed.
False - images that are not visible because of scroll location are not loaded until they are scrolled to.
member.remarks:
Images late loading improve performance if the page contains image outside the visible scroll area, especially if there is large amount of images, as all image loading is delayed (downloading and loading into memory).
Late image loading may effect the layout and actual size as image without set size will not have actual size until they are loaded resulting in layout change during user scroll.
Early image loading may also effect the layout if image without known size above the current scroll location are loaded as they will push the html elements down.

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Parse.CssParser.ParseStyleSheet(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Parse the given stylesheet source to CSS blocks dictionary.
The CSS blocks are organized into two level buckets of media type and class name.
Root media type are found under 'all' bucket.
If is true the parsed css blocks are added to the default css data (as defined by W3), merged if class name already exists. If false only the data in the given stylesheet is returned.
member.param: raw css stylesheet to parse
true - combine the parsed css data with default css data, false - return only the parsed css data
member.returns: the CSS data with parsed CSS objects (never null)

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.Parse.CssParser.ParseStyleSheet(TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.Core.CssData,System.String)
member.summary:
Parse the given stylesheet source to CSS blocks dictionary.
The CSS blocks are organized into two level buckets of media type and class name.
Root media type are found under 'all' bucket.

Applies style to all boxes in the tree.
If the html tag has style defined for each apply that style to the css box of the tag.
If the html tag has "class" attribute and the class name has style defined apply that style on the tag css box.
If the html tag has "style" attribute parse it and apply the parsed style on the tag css box.

Correct the DOM tree recursively by replacing "br" html boxes with anonymous blocks that respect br spec.
If the "br" tag is after inline box then the anon block will have zero height only acting as newline, but if it is after block box then it will have min-height of the font size so it will create empty line.

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlContainer.UseGdiPlusTextRendering
member.summary: Use GDI+ text rendering to measure/draw text.

remarks.para: GDI+ text rendering is less smooth than GDI text rendering but it natively supports alpha channel thus allows creating transparent images.
While using GDI+ text rendering you can control the text rendering using , note that using doesn't work well with transparent background.

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlContainer.CssData
member.summary: the parsed stylesheet data used for handling the html

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlContainer.AvoidGeometryAntialias
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if anti-aliasing should be avoided for geometry like backgrounds and borders (default - false).

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlContainer.AvoidAsyncImagesLoading
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if image asynchronous loading should be avoided (default - false).
True - images are loaded synchronously during html parsing.
False - images are loaded asynchronously to html parsing when downloaded from URL or loaded from disk.
member.remarks:
Asynchronously image loading allows to unblock html rendering while image is downloaded or loaded from disk using IO ports to achieve better performance.
Asynchronously image loading should be avoided when the full html content must be available during render, like render to image.

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlContainer.AvoidImagesLateLoading
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if image loading only when visible should be avoided (default - false).
True - images are loaded as soon as the html is parsed.
False - images that are not visible because of scroll location are not loaded until they are scrolled to.
member.remarks:
Images late loading improve performance if the page contains image outside the visible scroll area, especially if there is large amount of images, as all image loading is delayed (downloading and loading into memory).
Late image loading may effect the layout and actual size as image without set size will not have actual size until they are loaded resulting in layout change during user scroll.
Early image loading may also effect the layout if image without known size above the current scroll location are loaded as they will push the html elements down.

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlContainer.IsSelectionEnabled
member.summary:
Is content selection is enabled for the rendered html (default - true).
If set to 'false' the rendered html will be static only with ability to click on links.

member.name: P:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlContainer.ScrollOffset
member.summary:
The scroll offset of the html.
This will adjust the rendered html by the given offset so the content will be "scrolled".
member.example: Element that is rendered at location (50,100) with offset of (0,200) will not be rendered as it will be at -100 therefore outside the client rectangle.

The max width and height of the rendered html.
The max width will effect the html layout wrapping lines, resize images and tables where possible.
The max height does NOT effect layout, but will not render outside it (clip).
can be exceed the max size by layout restrictions (unwrappable line, set image size, etc.).
Set zero for unlimited (width\height separately).

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlRender
member.summary:
Standalone static class for simple and direct HTML rendering.
For low-level control and performance consider using .

remarks.para:
GDI vs. GDI+ text rendering
Windows supports two text rendering technologies: GDI and GDI+.
GDI is older, has better performance and looks better on standard monitors but doesn't support alpha channel for transparency.
GDI+ is newer, device independent so work better for printers but is slower and looks worse on monitors.
HtmlRender supports both GDI and GDI+ text rendering to accommodate different needs, GDI+ text rendering methods have "GdiPlus" suffix in their name where GDI do not.

Rendering to image
See https://htmlrenderer.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Image%20generation
Because of GDI text rendering issue with alpha channel clear type text rendering rendering to image requires special handling.
Solid color background - generate an image where the background is filled with solid color and all the html is rendered on top of the background color, GDI text rendering will be used. (RenderToImage method where the first argument is html string)
Image background - render html on top of existing image with whatever currently exist but it cannot have transparent pixels, GDI text rendering will be used. (RenderToImage method where the first argument is Image object)
Transparent background - render html to empty image using GDI+ text rendering, the generated image can be transparent. Text rendering can be controlled using , note that doesn't render well on transparent background. (RenderToImageGdiPlus method)

Overwrite stylesheet resolution
Exposed by optional "stylesheetLoad" delegate argument.
Invoked when a stylesheet is about to be loaded by file path or URL in 'link' element.
Allows to overwrite the loaded stylesheet by providing the stylesheet data manually, or different source (file or URL) to load from.
Example: The stylesheet 'href' can be non-valid URI string that is interpreted in the overwrite delegate by custom logic to pre-loaded stylesheet object
If no alternative data is provided the original source will be used.

Overwrite image resolution
Exposed by optional "imageLoad" delegate argument.
Invoked when an image is about to be loaded by file path, URL or inline data in 'img' element or background-image CSS style.
Allows to overwrite the loaded image by providing the image object manually, or different source (file or URL) to load from.
Example: image 'src' can be non-valid string that is interpreted in the overwrite delegate by custom logic to resource image object
Example: image 'src' in the html is relative - the overwrite intercepts the load and provide full source URL to load the image from
Example: image download requires authentication - the overwrite intercepts the load, downloads the image to disk using custom code and provide file path to load the image from.
If no alternative data is provided the original source will be used.
Note: Cannot use asynchronous scheme overwrite scheme.

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlRender.AddFontFamily(System.Drawing.FontFamily)
member.summary:
Adds a font family to be used in html rendering.
The added font will be used by all rendering function including and all WinForms controls.
member.remarks:
The given font family instance must be remain alive while the renderer is in use.
If loaded to then the collection must be alive.
If loaded from file then the file must not be deleted.
member.param: The font family to add.

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlRender.AddFontFamilyMapping(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Adds a font mapping from to iff the is not found.
When the font is used in rendered html and is not found in existing fonts (installed or added) it will be replaced by .
member.remarks: This fonts mapping can be used as a fallback in case the requested font is not installed in the client system.
member.param: the font family to replace
the font family to replace with

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.HtmlRender.ParseStyleSheet(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Parse the given stylesheet to object.
If is true the parsed css blocks are added to the default css data (as defined by W3), merged if class name already exists. If false only the data in the given stylesheet is returned.
member.param: the stylesheet source to parse
true - combine the parsed css data with default css data, false - return only the parsed css data

member.summary:
Measure the size (width and height) required to draw the given html under given max width restriction.
If no max width restriction is given the layout will use the maximum possible width required by the content, it can be the longest text line or full image width.
Use GDI text rendering, note has no effect.
member.param: Device to use for measure
HTML source to render
optional: bound the width of the html to render in (default - 0, unlimited)
optional: the style to use for html rendering (default - use W3 default style)
optional: can be used to overwrite stylesheet resolution logic
optional: can be used to overwrite image resolution logic
member.returns: the size required for the html

member.summary:
Measure the size (width and height) required to draw the given html under given max width restriction.
If no max width restriction is given the layout will use the maximum possible width required by the content, it can be the longest text line or full image width.
Use GDI+ text rending, use to control text rendering.
member.param: Device to use for measure
HTML source to render
optional: bound the width of the html to render in (default - 0, unlimited)
optional: the style to use for html rendering (default - use W3 default style)
optional: can be used to overwrite stylesheet resolution logic
optional: can be used to overwrite image resolution logic
member.returns: the size required for the html

members.member:
Renders the specified HTML into a new image of the requested size.
The HTML will be layout by the given size but will be clipped if cannot fit.
Limitation: The image cannot have transparent background, by default it will be white.
See "Rendering to image" remarks section on .
HTML source to render The size of the image to render into, layout html by width and clipped by height optional: the color to fill the image with (default - white) optional: the style to use for html rendering (default - use W3 default style) optional: can be used to overwrite stylesheet resolution logic optional: can be used to overwrite image resolution logic the generated image of the html if is .

Renders the specified HTML into a new image of unknown size that will be determined by max width/height and HTML layout.
If is zero the html will use all the required width, otherwise it will perform line wrap as specified in the html
If is zero the html will use all the required height, otherwise it will clip at the given max height not rendering the html below it.
Limitation: The image cannot have transparent background, by default it will be white.
See "Rendering to image" remarks section on .
HTML source to render optional: the max width of the rendered html, if not zero and html cannot be layout within the limit it will be clipped optional: the max height of the rendered html, if not zero and html cannot be layout within the limit it will be clipped optional: the color to fill the image with (default - white) optional: the style to use for html rendering (default - use W3 default style) optional: can be used to overwrite stylesheet resolution logic optional: can be used to overwrite image resolution logic the generated image of the html if is .

Renders the specified HTML into a new image of unknown size that will be determined by min/max width/height and HTML layout.
If .Width is zero the html will use all the required width, otherwise it will perform line wrap as specified in the html
If .Height is zero the html will use all the required height, otherwise it will clip at the given max height not rendering the html below it.
If (Width/Height) is above zero the rendered image will not be smaller than the given min size.
Limitation: The image cannot have transparent background, by default it will be white.
See "Rendering to image" remarks section on .
HTML source to render optional: the min size of the rendered html (zero - not limit the width/height) optional: the max size of the rendered html, if not zero and html cannot be layout within the limit it will be clipped (zero - not limit the width/height) optional: the color to fill the image with (default - white) optional: the style to use for html rendering (default - use W3 default style) optional: can be used to overwrite stylesheet resolution logic optional: can be used to overwrite image resolution logic the generated image of the html if is .

member.summary:

member.name: T:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.Utilities.ClipboardHelper
member.summary:
Helper to encode and set HTML fragment to clipboard.
See http://theartofdev.wordpress.com/2012/11/11/setting-html-and-plain-text-formatting-to-clipboard/.
.
member.remarks: The MIT License (MIT) Copyright (c) 2014 Arthur Teplitzki.

member.name: F:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.Utilities.ClipboardHelper.Header
member.summary:
The string contains index references to other spots in the string, so we need placeholders so we can compute the offsets.
The <<<<<<<_ strings are just placeholders. We'll back-patch them actual values afterwards.
The string layout (<<<) also ensures that it can't appear in the body of the html because the <
character must be escaped.

member.summary: html comment to point the beginning of html fragment

member.summary: html comment to point the end of html fragment

member.name: F:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.Utilities.ClipboardHelper._byteCount
member.summary: Used to calculate characters byte count in UTF-8

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.Utilities.ClipboardHelper.CreateDataObject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Create with given html and plain-text ready to be used for clipboard or drag and drop.
Handle missing <html> tags, specified start\end segments and Unicode characters.

remarks.para: Windows Clipboard works with UTF-8 Unicode encoding while .NET strings use with UTF-16 so for clipboard to correctly decode Unicode string added to it from .NET we needs to be re-encoded it using UTF-8 encoding.

Builds the CF_HTML header correctly for all possible HTMLs If given html contains start/end fragments then it will use them in the header: hello world If given html contains html/body tags then it will inject start/end fragments to exclude html/body tags: hello world If given html doesn't contain html/body tags then it will inject the tags and start/end fragments properly: hello world In all cases creating a proper CF_HTML header: Version:1.0 StartHTML:000000177 EndHTML:000000329 StartFragment:000000277 EndFragment:000000295 StartSelection:000000277 EndSelection:000000277 hello world See format specification here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/workshop/networking/clipboard/htmlclipboard.asp

member.param: a html fragment
the plain text

member.name: M:TheArtOfDev.HtmlRenderer.WinForms.Utilities.Win32Utils.GetWindowRect(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Rectangle@)
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.
member.remarks: In conformance with conventions for the RECT structure, the bottom-right coordinates of the returned rectangle are exclusive. In other words, the pixel at (right, bottom) lies immediately outside the rectangle.
member.param: A handle to the window.
A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.
member.remarks: In conformance with conventions for the RECT structure, the bottom-right coordinates of the returned rectangle are exclusive. In other words, the pixel at (right, bottom) lies immediately outside the rectangle.
member.param: A handle to the window.
member.returns: RECT structure that receives the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.
